author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Seventh grade football sweeps Washington
text:
Seventh grade football sweeps Washington Oct 01, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
WASHINGTON — The seventh-grade “Maroon Team” football team is on a four-game shutout streak to start off the season. This week, the Panthers shut out Washington on the road, 14-0 to move to 4-0. The “Gold Team” also won, 16-8, and moved to 2-2. 
Leading the Maroon defense was Tom Schnicker; Henry Lutovsky; Avery Scandridge, who recovered a fumble; and Mason Mills, who picked off one pass. Touchdowns were scored on a 35-yard pass from Brevin Wilson to Mitchell Moothart in the first quarter, and a 15-yard run by Brennen Bender in the third. 
In the gold game, David Watson started scoring off with a 50-yard touchdown run in the first quarter, and broke an 8-8 tie with a 60-yard run in the fourth. The defense played well, giving up just one score. Key players on defense were Darius Wacker, Luke Fraise and Chase Adams who had a fumble recovery. 
Both teams will be in action again on Tuesday, Oct. 6., when they hit the road to take on Ottumwa.
